H0.text: The rock cycle is the process in which igneous, sedimentary, and metamorphic rocks are converted into one another in stages.

H1.text: The erosion cycle is the process in which igneous, sedimentary, and metamorphic rocks are converted into one another in stages.

H2.text: The magma cycle is the process in which igneous, sedimentary, and metamorphic rocks are converted into one another in stages.

H3.text: The tectonic cycle is the process by which igneous, sedimentary, and metamorphic rocks are converted into one another in stages.

A6.text: a detailed Plate Tectonics rock cycle
